Summary Specialties:SAP (System Application & Products), BLS (Business Logistics Shipping), NMDB (Network Database), Wisard, Microsoft Access, Excel, Outlook, Word and PowerPoint Summary Specialties:SAP (System Application & Products), BLS (Business Logistics Shipping), NMDB (Network Database), Wisard, Microsoft Access, Excel, Outlook, Word and PowerPoint Specialties:SAP (System Application & Products), BLS (Business Logistics Shipping), NMDB (Network Database), Wisard, Microsoft Access, Excel, Outlook, Word and PowerPoint Specialties:SAP (System Application & Products), BLS (Business Logistics Shipping), NMDB (Network Database), Wisard, Microsoft Access, Excel, Outlook, Word and PowerPoint Experience Logistics Supplier Manager Intel Corporation July 2011  – Present (4 years 2 months) Chandler, Arizona •	Acting as a key contact for Arizona Capital moves between Capital Carriers, Site Capital Project Manager (SCPM), Buyers, Tool Owners and Dock Master. Communicate internally to Intel employees for any inquiries (such as: tracking Export/Import Capital shipments, customs issue related, post Good Receipts on Purchase Order) as well as communicate externally to Capital Carriers. 
•	Responsible for issuing Logistics Incident Follow up Tool (LIFTs) for Capital Carriers to document and manage resolution of transportation related issues and determine the root cause of each incident so effective action plans can be implemented to prevent the incident from recurring. 
•	Responsible for issuing Supplier Report Card (SRC) for Capital Carriers as a tool to communicate supplier’s overall performance for a given month. 
•	Responsible in alleviating EEE’s and additional costs by working with the stakeholders to get a true picture of the incoming shipments to meet factory schedules. 
•	A lead coordinator for weekly Dock Team Meetings for several Intel facilities (Fab32, CH4/ATTD, BBUL) to ensure that there is no issues meeting factory commits to all of the factories. 
•	Responsible for providing & processing paperwork for Intel’s various activities, such as: Resale Tools, Harvest Tools, Reuse Tools and Domestic Daily Truck. Arizona Site Traffic Coordinator Intel Corporation February 2006  –  July 2011  (5 years 6 months) • Involved in SAP deployment project from A-pipe into F-pipe by piloting shipments with different carriers and testing different transactions that resulted in faster processing time, easier to navigate and more efficient than the A-pipe. 
• Provided training & SOP (Standard Operating Procedure) in SAP for team members.  
• Created Arizona, Massachusetts & New Mexico Outbound/Inbound reports that included monitoring freight spends on a monthly basis. Responsible for analyzing each carrier’s freight spends and chargeable weight, identifying any “out of control” fluctuations, and researching further for explanations 
• Responsible for assigning the correct Carrier for all outbound international shipments & process shipment paperwork (Commercial Invoice, Packing List & Straight Bill of Ladings) for Finished Goods and Non Finished Good 
• File Shipper’s Export Declaration to US Customs as per Export/Import trade requirement about 30-40 in a weekly basis. 
• A main point of contact with Intel Arizona employees for traffic/transportation related questions. Communicate internally with Intel employees to receive responses to any inquiries (such as: tracking shipments, customs issue related) as well as externally to different carriers 
• Ensure that Intel remains compliant with US Customs regulations Outbound Documentation Customer Service Hanjin Shipping May 2003  –  February 2006  (2 years 10 months) • Checked master Bill of Ladings to ensure accuracy for outgoing shipments and ensured that Bill of Ladings are received from Shippers/Forwarders within stipulated time frame to avoid Customs penalty 
• Manifested and inputted ratings correctly according to each customer’s Service Contract after vessel sails, reconciled between manifest and load list to ensure details like the container & seal numbers on both documents match 
• Released Bill of Ladings, whether it is Original/Seaway/Telex Release, and distributed them in accordance with Shipper/Forwarder’s requirements

• Generated Ocean Shipping Manifest and Financial Recap weekly 
• Quoted and Negotiated Ocean, Inland and Intermodal rates

Expert in contract negotiation, supplier/stakeholders management and sourcing, business development, strategic planning, cost cutting initiatives and cross-functional leadership Experience Supplier Manager Intel Corporation August 2014  – Present (1 year 1 month) Chandler, AZ •	Supplier performance management: Responsible for managing largest semiconductor packaging equipment supplier with $20M yearly spends. Led a matrix managed team to focus on cost, quality, availability, technology and sustainability 
•	Cost reduction: Led a team to explore opportunities for cost reduction by outsourcing critical sub components and achieved 68% cost reduction and 50% lead time reduction while maintaining quality 
•	Strategic planning: Identified key technology areas and influence supplier senior management to focus on collaboration activities to make supplier and Intel market leaders 
•	Supplier development: Drive new/existing vendors to achieve Preferred Quality Supplier segmentation by performing to key metrics of excursion management, technology roadmap, cost reduction roadmap, leadtime and sustainability. This led to supplier moving to Certification status in 1 year timeframe 
 Program Manager Intel Corporation June 2012  –  July 2014  (2 years 2 months) Chandler, AZ •	Sourcing manager: Chaired a sourcing project and did an extensive industry benchmarking to identify and downselect key members of the ecosystem. Analyzed Total Cost of Ownership for next gen process development 
•	Quality/Operations manager: Influenced supplier and Intel senior management to collaborate in industry leading Ball Attach equipment development which lead to improved manufacturability, yield improvement to 99.98%, cycle time improvement by 15% and reduced product cost. 
•	Risk management leader: Led several task forces related to supply chain to ensure Intel meets product release timelines  
 Supply Chain Engineer Intel Corporation November 2010  –  May 2012  (1 year 7 months) Chandler, AZ •	Affordability lead: Delivered a healthy, affordable supply chain to deliver group’s technology roadmap in areas such as Inspection metrology and Ball Attach technology for Second and First Level interconnect process. Anticipated and timely addressed R&D needs while supporting existing supply chain 
•	Demand management and Ramp readiness: Successfully enabled supply chain readiness for new product/process development and ramp. Worked with Quality, Operations, Technology Development (TD)/High Volume factory Engineering and Supplier to drive closure to factory related issues and excursions 
•	Velocity lead: Identified and influenced supplier in a project to accelerate business velocity to meet volatile business requirements and demand/supply needs. Developed Key Performance Indicator’s, scorecards, time dependency models and metrics to measure the success of each deliverable. 
•	Six sigma: Team leader in a Green Belt project- used lean six sigma methodologies to optimize process flow by parts standardization.  
 
 Senior Process Development engineer Intel Corporation March 2009  –  November 2010  (1 year 9 months) Chandler, AZ •	Product development lead: Delivered risk assessments, empirical evaluations and certified a robust/reliable process with a high yield/throughput for high volume manufacturing. Technical lead in cross-functional task force group to drive yield attack, identifying and mitigating potential risks to product ramp geared to the certification of next generation technology. Utilized tools such as 7-step structured problem solving, Failure Modes Effects Analysis (FMEA) and conducting design of experiments (DOE) to address quality excursions.  
•	Change control champion: Championed Copy Exactly Audit and White Paper change control to ensure successful development and transfer of technology to HVM. 
•	New supplier evaluation and selection: Led a cross functional team to drive new equipment selection for Next Gen platforms. Conducted deep dive through industry scan, assessed, analyzed and consolidated data from potential suppliers and communicated decision clearly and succinctly to management
